description: From Ancient Greek φατός (phatós, “spoken”), from φημί (phēmí, “I say”).

adjectives.description: phatic (comparative more phatic, superlative most phatic)

entries.meaning: (linguistics) Pertaining to words used to convey any kind of social relationship.
examples: Generally speaking, statements in WE are expected to be of a tautologous nature, thus fulfilling the essential phatic nature of speech.
